home.title: Plot your next
home.description: String together mountain passes, gravel tracks, and border crossings. World Moto Trip Planner combines Google Maps routing with a lightweight trip log built for long-distance riders.

features.waypoints: Waypoint types for fuel, lodging, and POIs

home.signInPrompt: Sign in with Google to start laying out cross-continent routes, fuel stops, and waypoints you actually care about.
home.termsAgreement: By signing in you agree to our

demoCard.hint: Drop waypoints, then fine-tune in the editor. Your track updates as you go.

footer.disclaimer: World Moto Trip Planner · For trip planning only. Always ride within your limits and verify conditions on the ground.

feedback.title: Report a Bug or Request a Feature
feedback.description: Found something broken or have an idea to make the trip planner better? Let us know! Your feedback helps us build a better experience for all riders.
feedback.descriptionPlaceholderBug: What happened? What did you expect to happen? Steps to reproduce...
feedback.descriptionPlaceholderFeature: Describe the feature and why it would be useful...
feedback.viewOnGitHub: View the created issue on GitHub →
feedback.footerNote: Your feedback will be submitted as an issue on our
feedback.mustBeSignedIn: You must be signed in to submit feedback.

trips.title: Your routes
trips.subtitle: Saved legs, crossings, and loops you've mapped out for the next ride.
trips.noTrips: No routes yet. Start by plotting a shakedown loop near home.

newTrip.title: Plan a new route
newTrip.subtitle: Give this route a name and optional description. After creating it, you'll be taken to the full trip editor to add waypoints, fuel plan, schedule, and notes.
newTrip.garageHint: If you've picked a default bike in your Garage, it's pre-selected below. You can change it for this trip at any time.
newTrip.motorcycleHint: You can manage motorcycles in your Garage from the top nav.

garage.title: My motorcycles
garage.subtitle: Manage the bikes in your garage. You can associate any of these with a trip from the trip detail page.
garage.noMotorcycles: You don't have any motorcycles saved yet. From a trip detail page you can enter a bike and fetch specs from AI; it will show up here automatically.
garage.noDefaultSelected: None selected. New trips won't pre-fill a motorcycle.
garage.defaultBikeHint: New trips will start with this bike selected, but you can always change it per trip.
garage.addedNoSpecs: Motorcycle added, but specs could not be fetched
garage.addedSpecsLater: Motorcycle added, but specs could not be fetched right now. You can try again from a trip later.
garage.defaultUpdated: Default motorcycle for new trips updated.
garage.deleteConfirm: Delete this motorcycle from your garage? It will be permanently removed.
garage.inUseCannotDelete: This motorcycle is in use by one or more trips. Detach it from those trips before deleting.

tripDetail.startPlanningHint: Drop your first waypoint directly on the map below, or use the "Search address or place..." box to add a location. Then you can turn on nearby fuel, lodging, dining, and POI overlays.
tripDetail.mapDescription: Saved waypoints and the calculated route for this trip are shown below.
tripDetail.mapClickHint: Turn on "Add waypoints by clicking the map" to place new points,
tripDetail.mapSearchHint: or use the search box above the map.
tripDetail.clickToAddTip: Tip: When you want to lay down waypoints, enable
tripDetail.clickToAddTipEnd: below. Turn it off again to pan and explore without creating points.
tripDetail.unsavedChanges: You have unsaved waypoint changes. The route line reflects the last saved version and will update after saving.
tripDetail.deleteConfirm: Are you sure you want to delete this trip? This cannot be undone.
tripDetail.sharingEnabled: Anyone with the link can view
tripDetail.copyFailed: Unable to copy link; please copy it manually.
tripDetail.noWaypoints: No waypoints for this trip yet. Use the planning map or search box to add points, then save to update the route.
tripDetail.waypointsSaved: Waypoints saved; route and elevation recalculated.
tripDetail.waypointsSavedRouteError: Waypoints saved, but route could not be recalculated
tripDetail.aiPlanDescription: Get a suggested multi-day riding plan that calls out scenic legs and nearby points of interest along your waypoints.
tripDetail.aiSpecsHint: Or describe the bike you plan to ride and let AI estimate specs:
tripDetail.motorcycleAttached: Motorcycle attached to this trip and fuel settings adjusted.
tripDetail.specsApproximate: Specs are approximate and inferred from typical data. Verify against your specific bike and setup.
tripDetail.fuelSettingsDescription: Set your bike's comfortable range between fuel stops. We'll use this to flag risky legs between FUEL waypoints.
tripDetail.resetToBikeDefaults: Use Reset to bike defaults to pull range and reserve from the attached motorcycle's preferred (or estimated) values.
tripDetail.keepFuelInSync: Keep this trip's fuel settings in sync with
tripDetail.failedToResetFuel: Failed to reset fuel from motorcycle
tripDetail.scheduleDescription: Configure your ideal riding day to see when arrivals might push past your comfort window.
tripDetail.segmentDescription: Annotate tricky legs between waypoints: exposure, remoteness, weather risks, or surface changes.
tripDetail.checklistDescription: Capture the things you want to confirm before rolling out on this specific route.
tripDetail.noChecklistItems: No checklist items yet. Add a few above.
tripDetail.resetToAdvDefaults: Reset to ADV defaults (not yet saved).
tripDetail.routingError: Google's routing service couldn't find a drivable route between some of these waypoints. Try adjusting waypoints or splitting this trip into smaller segments. Your trip data is still intact.
tripDetail.networkError: We couldn't reach Google's routing service. Please try again in a bit. Your trip data is still intact.
tripDetail.unsavedWarningBanner: You have unsaved waypoint changes. Save and recalculate before leaving or your changes will be lost.
tripDetail.leavePageMessage: You have unsaved waypoint changes. If you leave now, these changes will be lost. Do you want to stay and save your changes?

sponsor.title: Sponsor console
sponsor.subtitle: View sponsor-facing demos, campaign concepts, and analytics for how riders interact with sponsored content in the planner.
sponsor.placeholder: This is a placeholder sponsor dashboard. We can expand this area with metrics such as impressions and click-through on sponsored gear blocks, trip types where your brand is most visible, and A/B experiments.
sponsor.accessNote: Access is limited to accounts with the

admin.subtitle: Manage users, roles, and application-wide settings for World Moto Trip Planner.
admin.navDescription: Use the navigation below to review users and assign roles such as
admin.usersSubtitle: View all accounts and assign application roles.

terms.title: Terms of Service
terms.metaTitle: Terms of Service | World Moto Trip Planner
terms.intro: World Moto Trip Planner ("the app") is provided to help you plan motorcycle trips and related route details. By using the app you agree to these Terms of Service.
terms.riskP1: Riding a motorcycle is inherently risky. The app provides planning tools only and does not constitute navigation advice, safety advice, or legal guidance. You are solely responsible for your own riding decisions, including the roads you choose, your speed, and how you react to conditions.
terms.riskP2: Always verify actual road conditions, regulations, closures, and weather before you ride, and obey all local laws.
terms.warrantyP1: The app is provided on an "as is" and "as available" basis, without warranties of any kind, whether express or implied. We do not guarantee the accuracy, completeness, or availability of any routes, distances, times, elevation data, or other information in the app.
terms.accountsP1: You are responsible for maintaining the confidentiality of your account and for any activity that occurs under it. You agree not to use the app to:
terms.accountsList1: Break the law or violate third-party rights.
terms.accountsList2: Upload abusive, hateful, or otherwise inappropriate content.
terms.accountsList3: Attempt to disrupt or compromise the service or its infrastructure.
terms.thirdPartyP1: The app depends on third-party services such as Google Maps Platform, authentication providers (for example Google and Facebook), and managed database hosting. Your use of those services is additionally subject to their own terms and policies.
terms.changesServiceP1: The app may change, be suspended, or be discontinued at any time without notice. Features may be added, removed, or modified as the project evolves.
terms.liabilityP1: To the maximum extent permitted by law, the maintainers of this project are not liable for any direct, indirect, incidental, special, or consequential damages, or loss of data or opportunities, arising out of or in connection with your use of the app.
terms.changesTermsP1: We may update these Terms of Service from time to time. When we do, we will update the "Last updated" date at the top of this page. Your continued use of the app after changes take effect means you accept the revised terms.
terms.contactP1: If you have questions about these terms, please contact the maintainer of this project.

privacy.title: Privacy Policy
privacy.metaTitle: Privacy Policy | World Moto Trip Planner
privacy.intro: World Moto Trip Planner ("the app") helps you plan long-distance motorcycle routes and related trip details. This page describes what data we collect, how it is used, and the choices you have.
privacy.authP1: When you sign in, we use third-party identity providers such as Google and Facebook via NextAuth. From these providers we may receive basic profile information including:
privacy.authP2: This information is used only to create and identify your account in the app so that your trips are stored securely for you.
privacy.tripDataP1: When you use the app, we store trip-related data in our database, including:
privacy.tripDataList2: Waypoints, waypoint names, notes, and types (fuel, lodging, POI, etc.)
privacy.tripDataList3: Computed route metrics such as distance, duration, elevation summaries
privacy.tripDataList4: Fuel range settings, schedule preferences, and daily planning information
privacy.tripDataList5: Pre-ride checklist items and completion state
privacy.tripDataList6: Optional risk and notes you attach to segments between waypoints
privacy.tripDataP2: This data is used solely to provide planning features to you (for example, showing your trips, exporting GPX, and calculating elevation or fuel legs).
privacy.thirdPartyP1: The app uses several third-party services to function:
privacy.thirdPartyList1: for maps, routing, and elevation data.
privacy.thirdPartyP2: These providers may process IP addresses and other technical information as part of delivering their services. Your use of Google and Facebook is also governed by their respective privacy policies and terms.
privacy.cookiesP1: We use cookies and session storage through NextAuth to keep you signed in and associate your browser with your account. These cookies are not used for advertising; they are only used for authentication and security.
privacy.dataShareP1: We do not sell your personal information. Trip data and account details are used only to operate this application. Limited personnel and service providers (for example, our hosting and database providers) may have access as necessary to operate and maintain the service.
privacy.dataShareP2: Trip data is retained while your account is active. We may retain limited logs for a period of time for security, debugging, and abuse prevention.
privacy.choicesP1: You can sign out at any time from the app header. If you would like your account and associated trips to be deleted, please contact the maintainer of this project and include the email address you use to sign in.
privacy.contactP1: If you have questions about this privacy policy or how your data is handled, please contact the app maintainer.
privacy.contactP2: This app is provided as a planning aid only. It is not a navigation product and should not be relied on as the sole source of route or safety information.

accessibility.title: Accessibility commitment
accessibility.goalP1: World Moto Trip Planner is being developed with the goal of meeting the spirit and requirements of the Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA) and the Web Content Accessibility Guidelines (WCAG) 2.1 at the AA level.
accessibility.goalP2: We want riders using assistive technologies—including screen readers, screen magnifiers, and keyboard-only navigation—to be able to plan trips, understand routes, and manage trip details as effectively as possible.
accessibility.workingOnList1: Improving keyboard navigation and focus order across all interactive elements.
accessibility.workingOnList2: Providing clear labels, headings, and regions for screen reader users.
accessibility.workingOnList3: Ensuring sufficient color contrast and visible focus indicators for maps, overlays, and trip detail controls.
accessibility.workingOnList4: Offering text-based alternatives for information that is primarily shown on the map, such as waypoint lists, route summaries, and elevation details.
accessibility.limitationsP1: Some parts of the application are still under active development and may not yet fully meet WCAG 2.1 AA, especially complex map interactions and custom controls. We are incrementally improving these areas and welcome feedback on specific issues you encounter.
accessibility.feedbackP1: If you experience any accessibility barriers while using the app, please let us know so we can investigate and address them.
accessibility.feedbackP2: When you contact us, if possible, include:
accessibility.feedbackList1: The page or feature where the issue occurred.
accessibility.feedbackList2: The browser, operating system, and assistive technology you are using.
accessibility.feedbackList3: A brief description of the problem.
accessibility.feedbackP3: You can reach the maintainer of this project using the same contact details referenced in our
accessibility.improvementP1: Accessibility is an ongoing process. As the app evolves, we will continue to audit new features against WCAG 2.1 AA, fix issues that are reported or discovered, and refine our design to better support all riders.

dataDeletion.title: Data Deletion Instructions
dataDeletion.metaTitle: Data Deletion Instructions | World Moto Trip Planner
dataDeletion.intro: This page explains how to request deletion of your account and associated data from World Moto Trip Planner.
dataDeletion.whatDeletedP1: When we delete your account, we will remove:
dataDeletion.whatDeletedList1: Your user account record used to sign in to the app.
dataDeletion.whatDeletedList2: All trips you have created, including waypoints and route details.
dataDeletion.whatDeletedList3: Associated planning data (fuel range settings, schedule preferences, checklist items, and segment notes).
dataDeletion.howToP1: To request deletion of your data:
dataDeletion.howToList1: Sign in to the app and confirm the email address shown in the header matches the account you want to delete.
dataDeletion.howToList2: Contact the maintainer of this project and clearly state that you would like your account and trips deleted. Include the email address you use to sign in to World Moto Trip Planner.
dataDeletion.howToP2: Once your request is received and verified, your account and associated data will be removed from the live database within a reasonable time.
dataDeletion.thirdPartyP1: If you used Google or Facebook to sign in, deleting your account in World Moto Trip Planner does not delete your Google or Facebook accounts. To manage those accounts, please use the tools provided by Google and Facebook directly.
dataDeletion.moreInfoP1: For details on what data we collect and how it is used, please see our
